page.title: 01Summary of the area.
page.content: This area contains North & South Brewham.There are two roads in it.The farming is mainly dairy & sheep.The farms are mainly Georgian and quite small.The houses are mainly council which are quite old,and there are not many new buildings except for South Brewham where there is a small amount. The boundary of Wiltshire & Somerset lies in this area and it runs around the far side of King's Wood Warren, a coniferous wood owned by the Forestry Commision,where there has been a lot of forestry work and felling of trees. King Alfred's Tower is in this area and it is owned by the National Trust, which can be seen for miles around.
